page.title: 02STAPLETON FARM
page.content: Stapleton Farm is a 230 acres dairy farm. It is mainly grassland, with the rest arable, shared moorland of 25 acres and 25 acres of fenced deciduous woodland. There are three members of the family running the farm. Attached to the farm is a yoghurt producing plant run by three family members and six employees. It was started in 1975 as a cottage industry using one churn of milk per day and now uses 1000 litres daily. Two thirds comes from Stapleton Farm, the rest from the Milk Marketing Board. As well as the yoghurt 600 lbs. of cream are produced each week. These products are sold throughout Devon and in places as far away as Bristol and London.
